title: 109_hr3988
content: The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" gives priority to businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. Federal departments must award a minimum of 30% for prime contracts and 40% for subcontracting to small businesses. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that federal agencies allocate a minimum of 30% for prime contracts and 40% for subcontracts to small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Agencies must also ensure compliance with subcontracting goals for small businesses under the Small Business Act and Federal Acquisition Regulations. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" requires federal agencies to allocate a minimum percentage of contracts to small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress within 2 years, detailing the opportunities for small businesses under this provision. This subsection will end one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses treated as HUBZone for Small Business Act purposes. SEC. 4. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. No federal facility can be permanently moved from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. This restriction expires after two years from the enactment of this Act. Reports are required for facilities temporarily relocated for over 6 months. The section specifies the date when the temporary relocation of a facility from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area takes effect. Additional reports on the status of the relocation must be submitted every 6 months for the duration of the temporary relocation period. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small business concern" as a small business located in a Gulf hurricane-affected area as of August 28, 2005. It also defines "Gulf hurricane disaster" as an event caused by Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita declared a major disaster by the President. Additionally, it defines "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area" as a county or parish in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita. The term "small business concern" in this Act refers to a business as defined under the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act will be effective 10 days after its enactment.
